results.title: Technical Writer
results.description:
At Bluesight, our mission is to create groundbreaking medication intelligence solutions that increase efficiency, safety and visibility for health systems and pharmaceutical manufacturers.  We empower our customers to deliver the right medicine to the right patient at the right time, every time.  We are a high growth healthcare software technology company with a start-up 'vibe' but over 1000 customers tracking medications using our proven and established solutions.
 
Bluesight is looking for a Technical Writer to support development, review, and delivery of our products. This position works closely with engineers and stakeholders to create digital and printed content that effectively conveys requirements to partners, informs of our policies and standards, and facilitates effective communication with stakeholders. This position will work across the company and at all levels in order to review and interpret the results of technical studies, whitepapers, and proposals.



Job Duties and Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with product managers and other subject matter experts to create content
  • Maintain and update content as the products evolve
  • Communicate complex concepts clearly in a concise and organized manner
  • Develop finished documents and presentations with proper grammar that adhere to agency style guides and publication standards
  • Ensure language presentation is consistent with Bluesight style guides and specialized vocabulary of subject matter fields
  • Other duties and technical projects as assigned



Qualifications and Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
  • 2+ years of writing and delivering compelling technical documentation for complex software
  • Solid organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management
  • Experience and understanding of information management/information architecture fundamentals such as version control, content management, single sourcing and metadata
  • Must be comfortable interacting with engineers, management, and end-users of varying experience levels
  • Experience building E-Learning modules is a major plus
  • Experience with DOC 360 is a plus 
The standard base pay range for this role is $60,000 - $75,000. In addition to a base salary this position is also eligible for an amazing benefits package. Actual amount of salary will vary depending on position offered, experience, performance, and location.
 
This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States.
 
Why Bluesight?
Bluesight’s culture is built on innovation and teamwork. There’s room to grow and opportunities to take initiative. You will partner with sharp, motivated teammates looking to disrupt a massive industry—and have fun doing it.  We truly believe that where you work and what you do matters.  Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape!
-Competitive salary
-Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days!
-Generous insurance coverage
-401k program with a company match
-Employee stock options
-Fun, collaborative culture!
 
EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability
 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Copywriting and Content Specialist
results.description:
About Kisi

Kisi is a security platform with offices in Brooklyn and Stockholm and a global remote team spanning from America, Europe, Africa and Asia. We create hardware and software that helps businesses connect and control their spaces through the cloud.

A little bit more about our team:

  • We value being forward, human, trusted, and responsible. As a team, we make a tangible and lasting impact on the real world.

  • Our product (Reader Pro) is an award-winning access control solution. We are a design focused company and recently won the coveted GOOD DESIGN award as well as the prestigious iF Design Award.

  • Our customers and users come first - We are rated 4.9 in the App Store and 4.8 on Capterra.

  • Our team is unique (and a bit quirky) and diverse. We hail from 25 nationalities (& counting!) and look forward to our annual global meetup to bring the whole team together.

  • We are building a supportive and flexible working environment by offering health & retirement benefits (location based), generous vacation time and daily challenges and growth.

 

About the Role

We are seeking a content and copywriter who is adept at taking technical concepts and weaving them into engaging content that our audience of different levels of technical expertise can enjoy. The ideal candidate will have exceptional writing abilities with strength in copywriting and crafting short-form and on-point messages, CTAs, and more.

This role will work across a variety of content initiatives. Your skills in copywriting will aid us in crafting messages for emails, paid media, UX tests, website content, and more. You will also work with our team on assisting with developing blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, and social media messaging.

You will work closely with our existing Content Strategist and our Community Strategist to help craft messaging and review content prior to publishing. This role is remote for candidates in Europe or within the East Coast of the US (must be based in one of the following states: CT, DE, FL, MA, MD, NC, NH, NJ, NY, OH, PA, TN).

 

Responsibilities:

  • Being a core part of our content review process

  • Crafting and owning email sequences for our target audiences with the goal of convincing and converting them

  • Regularly testing email sequences and messaging to find the best fit

  • Being part of our UX testing when it comes to messaging

  • Crafting sales collateral (one-pagers, reference documents, and more)

  • Developing website content and messaging

  • Assisting with crafting whitepapers, use-cases

  • Assisting with conducting customer interviews for case-studies and market research

  • Assisting with blog posts and other content-related needs

Requirements:

  • English as a native language

  • Copywriting skills

  • Ability to understand technical concepts and distill those into engaging content

  • Ability to write technical content as needed

  • Ability to work closely with our team in Europe in their time-zone (or significant overlaps)

  • Ability to write for a variety of target audiences, understand their different needs and craft messaging unique to each audience

  • A + if you have an understanding of SEO, Paid Search or testing methodologies

results.title: Experience Design Manager
results.description:
Experience Design Manager

Location: Wherever you are (Remote) 

Are you a seasoned designer with a passion for crafting innovative designs that improve accessibility and modernize user experiences? A leader who has built design teams that focus on human-first methodology? Do you thrive working on a collaborative, remote team? If so, Servos is looking for an Experience Design Manager to lead the way in designing unique sites for ServiceNow customers across the country.

We Are 

• An Elite ServiceNow Partner specializing in Customer (CSM/FSM) and Creator Workflows (AppEngine)

• A virtual team throughout the United States with headquarters in Virginia

• Devoted to doing the right thing for our clients and team by leading with a human-first culture

• An experienced team of consultants who are dedicated to having fun and adding value

• Open minded and always welcoming new ideas and approaches

You Are 

• A leading designer with at least five years of UI/UX design experience under your belt, including managing and growing design teams

• An innovator in your field that is continuously learning how the most modern Experience Design trends, principles, and best practices are impacting peoples' lives

• Capable of guiding clients, or stakeholders, through design blueprints and articulating the processes required for achieving them

• Willing to learn how the ServiceNow platform will affect the solutions you design 

• A go-to member of the design team for working directly with your clients, stakeholders, and executives to identify design requirements, user journeys and ideal workflows through virtual and in-person workshops 

• A collaborative team member able to take constructive feedback from clients and internal teams 

• Highly skilled Adobe XD, Figma, or other prototyping software as well as Frontend development (Bootstrap, SCSS, HTML and CSS)

• An adventurer willing to travel up to 20% of the time 

What You'll Do 

• Lead our Experience team in creating user experiences that solve real-world problems, follow client brand standards, and contribute to the expansion of our developed service offerings 

• Collaborate with the leaders and developers on our Delivery team to provide them with the guidance they need to build dynamic, configurable site components, including style guides, state changes, and detailed mockups 

• Be the face of the Servos Experience Design team for clients by building trusted relationships with stakeholders and being a lead participant in the full lifecycle of the design process to ensure integrity of solutions built

• Manage, guide, and mentor the Experience Design team members on best practices and being able to provide rich, top tier solutions

• Become familiar with the ServiceNow product as well as best practices for translating designs into it

• Lead the efforts of maintaining overall brand consistency across the organization through creation of marketing assets, internal brand awareness, brand expansion brainstorming, and more 

What We Offer 

• A family first culture with unlimited PTO after the first year  

• Health benefits with free coverage for you and competitive rates for your family 

• 401K match and a variety of other benefits 

• An investment in your continued growth and development with paid training opportunities

results.title: Senior Business Analyst (Core Claims)
results.description:
Company Description

CNSI delivers a broad range of health information technology enterprise solutions and customizable products to a diverse base of state and federal agencies. We align, build, and manage innovative, high-quality, cost-effective solutions that help customers achieve their mission, enhance business performance, reduce costs, and improve health for over 51 million Americans.



Job Description

CNSI is empowering the delivery of public sector healthcare in claims and encounter processing platforms, provider support solutions, and promoting consumer engagement and interoperability. Our technology-enabled products and solutions connect consumers, payers, and providers to improve health outcomes for one in five Americans.

Summary:

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing business problems, identifying gaps, and developing technical solutions involving complex information systems under some to no supervision for Claims and related systems such as Benefits Administration, Member Eligibility, Prior Authorization, Third Party Liability (TPL), Pricing/Edits, and Financial Services.  This role involves managing requirement scope, determining appropriate methods on potential assignments, serving as a bridge between information technology teams and the client through all project phases, and providing day-to-day direction on State program activities.

This role requires the selected candidate to work Mountain Time Zone hours.

To learn more about us, check us out at www.cns-inc.com

Industry Recognition - Press Release: https://bit.ly/3rv8Ito

Job Responsibilities:

  • Works with customers on presenting technical solutions for complex business functionalities
  • Possesses unwavering commitment to customer service and operational excellence
  • Provides customer support through leading client demos and presentations
  • Prioritizes and schedules work assignments based on the project plan and handles multiple tasks across project phases
  • Creates and modifies Business Process Models
  • Understands the overall system architecture and cross-functional integration
  • Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of business analysis related to Core Claims to ensure high quality
  • Demonstrates advanced expertise and contributes to the Business Analysis practice by publishing technology points of view through the creation of white papers
  • Possesses in-depth knowledge and is well-versed in multiple functions or capabilities
  • Uses cases, workflow diagrams, and gap analysis to create and modify requirements documents and design specifications
  • Analyzes user requirements and client business needs, leveraging expert opinion and expertise
  • Acts as the requirements subject matter expert and supports requirements change management
  • Travel up to 5% annually, as requested



Qualifications

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree with 7+ years of business analysis experience OR Master's degree with 5+ years of business analysis experience
  • 5+ years of experience at large complex organizations, including leading centralized or matrixed teams
  • 5+ years of experience on large complex projects and domain knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid and/or healthcare verticals
  • 3+ years of Lead Business Analyst experience on large complex projects
  • Medicaid / Medicare (healthcare) background
  • Strong knowledge in Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) around Claims processing and related subsystems
  • Business Analysis Process (SDLC, documentation procedures) experience
  • High level of technical and database knowledge
  • Experience facilitating and running JAD requirements design sessions, etc.
  • Excellent requirements elicitation and validation skills

Preferred Experience/Skills:

  • Excellent customer relation skills, including presentation and meeting facilitation
  • Strong knowledge and proficiency in SQL
  • Knowledge of the Quality-of-Care program
  • Knowledge of data integration and software enhancements/planning



Additional Information

About Us:

At CNSI, we strive to be the market leader and most trusted partner for innovative and transformative technology-enabled solutions that improve health outcomes and reduce costs. We’re passionate about helping our clients improve the health and well-being of individuals and families. We succeed when our clients succeed.

Innovation and commitment to our mission are core to our DNA. And through our shared values, we foster an environment of inclusion, empowerment, accountability, and fun! You will be offered a competitive compensation and benefits package.

CNSI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic status, family responsibilities, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. We are proud of our diversity and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Kindly inquire during the interview process if this position is subject to President Biden’s Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, requiring you to be vaccinated by December 8, 2021.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Are you a self-starter who thrives on making a difference in the lives of others? Do you love building meaningful rapport with clients? Are you looking to make a splash as a part of a small but growing team? Then we’re looking for you!

We are looking to expand our Customer Success team so that we can continue to grow, while ensuring that our current clients have access to the best FMX experience possible.

The Account Manager role is a part of the Customer Success team, otherwise known as FMX’s secret weapon. We stand-out in the industry due to our best-in-class Customer Success, which has earned us a 98% customer satisfaction rating! The main objective of this role is customer-retention. You will serve as the point of contact for accounts post-implementation, working to ensure satisfaction and proper adoption of FMX, while also upselling and cross-selling additional features. You can expect to dedicate 5% of your time to support, 5% to specific projects, 45% to client retention, and 45% to upselling. You'll be working in a fast-paced, high-energy, and collaborative environment, where you'll be expected to show up every day and impact the strategy and culture of the company in a positive way.

Responsibilities:

● Serve as the dedicated point of contact for accounts post-implementation and own the overall customer relationship by ensuring retention through driving value, user adoption, and satisfaction

● Maintain a low churn rate (< 2%)

● Upsell and cross-sell additional features of the FMX software, and implement new modules or features as necessary

● Keep accounts in compliance with the licenses that were purchased

● Record meetings, phone calls, follow-ups, and miscellaneous tasks in Gainsight

● Follow upsell and expansion playbook to work an account from qualified to closed

● Build strong relationships with the customer executive levels and ensure they are consistently seeing the value of FMX

Requirements

● You have a proven knowledge of the FMX software

● You are advanced in Microsoft Office, specifically Microsoft Excel

● You are excellent at building and nurturing relationships

● You are able to effectively communicate with customers, while empathizing and understanding what success means to them

● You have an understanding of when to proactively reach out to customers

● You are proficient in the basics of Salesforce data schema and configuration

● You are able to be flexible and occasionally work outside of our FMX standard operating hours

● You effectively communicate in clear and simple terms, and are able to build rapport with customers and executives

● You have an innovative way of thinking to creatively solve problems

● You have a positive, customer-centric attitude

● You are self-motivated and complete work in a timely manner

● You are committed to continuous improvement and are coachable

● You possess effective presentation and negotiation skills

The hiring process for this role:

  • Apply! Submit your resume and answers to the application questions below via the Workable portal.
  • Phone screen with HR: A 30-minute conversation to review your background and experiences, discuss the culture at FMX, and ensure that you understand the general expectations for the role. Also, a great time for you to ask questions about compensation, benefits, etc.
  • Hiring manager conversation: A 60-minute conversation with the Manager of Account Managers and the Director of Customer Success. Be prepared to discuss your background as well as what you’re looking for in your next role and what direction you see your career path taking. Also, a great time for you to ask questions about the expectations for this role, team culture, etc.
  • Final Interview: A 30-minute interview with the VP of Customer Success and a Customer Success teammate. This will include:
    • Questions for you from the team on your background, etc.
    • Questions from you on team culture, day-to-day, upcoming goals, etc.

Benefits

  • FMX Benefits and Life at FMX:
    • You’ll make a big impact: You’ll have significant influence over the direction of our product and the future of our company.
    • Enjoy flexible working hours: Have a dentist appointment at 8:30 AM? Need to tack on an extra 15 minutes at lunch to squeeze in that workout? As long as you're getting your work done then our working hours are flexible.
    • Work from home: At FMX we are remote first, but you’re welcome to use our office as you need. We have two all-company events a year to ensure that you can put a face to that name and establish high-trust relationships with your teammates and co-workers. When you’re in the office, you can take advantage of our free snacks, beverages, and office kegerator.
    • You’ll enjoy a collaborative culture and a close-knit team: We're a team of hard-working, high-fiving, friendly folks. We take collaboration, transparency, continuous improvement, and work/life balance seriously.
    Compensation:
    • The base salary range for this position is expected to be $50,000. There is also bonus potential.
    • 401(k) and medical / dental / vision insurance
    Other considerations: The candidate for this position can be located anywhere in the US.

    Company: FMX is founded and headquartered in Columbus, Ohio and develops a cloud-based, software-as-a-service facility maintenance and management product. FMX serves education, property management, manufacturing, and other markets and is one of the fastest-growing companies in its space. Check us out at: https://www.gofmx.com/
    Note: All other company requirements are documented in the FMX Teammate Handbook. FMX is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

results.title: Website Marketing Manager
results.description:
Why We’re Hiring:

We are looking for a Website Marketing Manager to drive growth and continuous improvement to the Harvest website, our most valuable marketing asset.

In this role, you will collaborate with key business stakeholders (demand gen, product marketing, engineering, design, content, etc.) and external agency partners to develop, maintain, and support all marketing initiatives related to the Harvest website. These initiatives include, but are not limited to: SEO & CRO management, website performance monitoring, technical maintenance, implementation of web best practices, web development, and more.

To be successful in this role, you should be curious, analytical, and creative, applying your web marketing expertise to maximize our website's marketing performance.

Requirements

What You’ll Do:

You will serve as the gatekeeper of Harvest’s website, which includes:

  • Website Performance Monitoring:
    • Establish, maintain and update health metrics for the Harvest website
    • Identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for web metrics
    • Configure, manage, monitor, and update Google Analytics, Google Search Console, etc., in cross-collaboration with key business stakeholders and external agency partners
    • Develop performance reports and dashboards to reflect website performance
    • Identify and develop strategies to grow subscriber base and web traffic metrics
  • Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Management:
    • Develop and implement CRO tests in collaboration with Demand Gen Lead and periodically with our external CRO agency partner
    • Monitor test performance, establish and provide reporting metrics and recommendations based on each test
    • Conceptualize new tests (design layout & content) working in collaboration with product marketing expert, designer and content writer
  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Management:
    • Working closely with Demand Gen lead and external SEO agency to implement SEO recommendations; provide input and contribute to overall SEO strategy based on visitor interaction/behavior
    • Identify gaps/opportunities and make suggestions on ways to continuously update our site (content and structure) to improve SEO
    • Monitor organic search rankings and provide regular reporting to Marketing team and agency partner
  • Web Development & Technical Maintenance:
    • Manage website content, conducting audits to eliminate redundant, outdated, or duplicate content
    • Create and update landing pages in collaboration with the Demand Generation lead
    • Implement design updates in collaboration with the Creative Design Manager, ensuring the website aligns with brand strategy and meets the organization’s design standards
    • Create, update, and maintain CMS templates and modules
    • Respond to and troubleshoot all website issues
    • Recommend and implement regular improvements to the user experience
    • Ensure full compliance of the website with all laws and regulations (i.e. GDPR)
    • Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and monitor competitor websites
What You’ll Do:
  • Proven work experience as a Website Marketing Manager, Online Marketing Manager or similar role (5+ years of experience preferred)
  • BS degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field
  • Extensive knowledge of website performance/optimization principles and strategies
  • Experience with CRM/CMS software (i.e., HubSpot; Built and maintained HubSpot CMS themes, templates, and modules, or a similar platform
  • Highly proficient with HTML and CSS
  • Basic knowledge of Javascript, HubL
  • Experience managing code with Git
  • Managed and maintained platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google AdWords, Optimizely, and more.
  • Project management experience
  • Detailed understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
  • Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot website issues in a timely, urgent manner
  • Established key web metrics, identified areas for improvement, and implemented those changes
  • Appetite and effort to stay up to date on the latest trends
  • Strong attention to detail with an analytical mind to problem-solve
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while delivering results

    Benefits

    • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
    • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
    • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
    • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
    • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
    • Short Term & Long Term Disability
    • Training & Development
    • Work From Home
    • Wellness Resources

results.title: Principal Sound Designer
results.description:
Methodical Games is a newly formed studio built around a fundamental set of ideals; a lean talented team, direct cross-discipline collaboration, quick iteration, and developer-driven processes. Our goal is to foster a haven for developers to push the bounds of their craft and collaborate directly with other creative minds. As our name suggests, we pride ourselves on a detail oriented approach to game development with a focus on meticulously crafted gameplay. You might even call it an obsession. We’re seeking passionate individuals from all walks of life to join us in building something great.

 

We are looking for an experienced Principal Sound Designer. As the first member of the audio department, you will leverage your dual expertise in the technical and creative aspects of sound design to define signature audio for a new IP built in Unreal Engine 5. Our ideal candidate is passionate about games and is excited by the possibilities of crafting an immersive soundscape that will bring fantastical worlds to life.

 

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with a small team to guide decisions for all things audio.

  • Establish audio software and hardware requirements.

  • Sound design for a wide range of game contexts - UI, gameplay, ambience, music, etc.

  • Drive audio pipeline research and development.

  • Conduct field recordings.

  • Collaborate with other disciplines to establish design goals.

  • Implement sound effects and music in Unreal Engine 5.

  • Musical scoring and editing.

  • Enhance player immersion through audio design.

  • Play and give feedback on the game. Your voice matters.

 

Qualifications

  • 5+ years experience as an audio designer.

  • Portfolio demonstrating creative and technical achievements in sound design, ideally project defining content.

  • A deep appreciation for how audio contributes to gameplay feel and communicates key information to players.

  • Proficiency in all aspects of sound design - from creation, to implementation, to post production.

  • Experience and proficiency with pro audio tools and hardware.

  • Extensive audio recording, processing, and mixing skills.

  • Fluent in Unreal Engine audio systems.

  • An understanding of next gen console audio capabilities.

  • Passion for making and playing games.

 

Nice to Have

  • Experience with advanced audio features in Unreal Engine 5.

  • Experience with multiplayer games.

  • Unreal Blueprint scripting skills.

  • Shipped console game experience.

 

Not an exact match for this role? We’d still love to hear from you! Visit our Careers Page and fill out the Open Application to apply.

 

How we work

  • Methodical Games is a remote hybrid studio with an office in Raleigh, North Carolina. We are building an office first culture centered around collaboration, but we are open to fully remote work depending on the position and candidate.

  • Everyone is a hands-on contributor and we believe in leading by example.

  • We’re a small cross-discipline team communicating directly with one another.

  • It is important to us to maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

 

What we offer

  • Competitive salary.

  • Generous equity and profit sharing.

  • Unlimited paid time off, Summer and Winter breaks.

  • Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance with 100% of premiums covered for employees.

  • 401(k) retirement plan and Flex Spending accounts.

  • Relocation assistance to the Raleigh area.

  • Centrally located office minutes from downtown Raleigh, Cary, and Durham. Walk to PNC Arena (home of the Carolina Hurricanes). Garage parking with free EV charging!

results.title: A.I. Programmer
results.description:
Climax Studios was established nearly 30 years ago, we have an extensive history in developing all kinds of digital experiences across all formats, and we have won multiple awards along the way.

We have a state of the art studio located in the heart of the beautiful Gunwharf Quays in Portsmouth overlooking the Harbour.

You take your creativity seriously and games should be what get you fired up and passionate. At Climax we embrace those who see things in a different way and aren’t afraid to try-out new things and push themselves out of their comfort zones.

We are looking for a deeply talented, fully remote A.I. Programmer to help us generate the best open world experiences in our games and push the limits of Artificial intelligence in areas such as pathfinding, combat, and decision-making.

We are seeking down to earth and creative thinking programmer, a coder who can bring their experience and considerable coding talents to our studio, an engineer that we can learn from as well as teach and grow with.

Responsibilities

  • Work with existing engine code base to develop and improve AI.
  • Develop AI / game code as well as tools and extend it for high profile projects.
  • Specify and contribute to testing procedures.
  • Integrate creative and technical design processes while ensuring that high production values are never compromised.

Qualifications

  • A degree in computer science, games development or equivalent.
  • Minimum of 2 years commercial games programming experience.

Requirements

  • A high level of proficiency with C++
  • Solid experience with Unreal 4/5.
  • Excellent math.
  • Proven problem-solving ability.
  • Broad familiarity with AI in game development is required.
  • You would also have experience of developing modern character AI systems.
  • Experience of pathfinding, steering, and motion planning.
  • State machines and behaviour trees.
  • Implementing cooperation and group behaviours
  • Experience of working within a team.
  • A real passion for games programming.

Please don’t forget to include your CV, a cover letter, and most importantly a link to your GitHub, website or portfolio, it’s very difficult for us to assess your code abilities if you don’t provide us with any. Please remember that we make games and games are fun so it we would love to receive a well-written and passionate cover letter.

Benefits

  • Excellent holiday package
  • Regular social events
  • Cycle To Work Scheme
  • Fresh fruit and snacks
  • A friendly, focused, ambitious and relaxed working environment
  • Ongoing training and development, with career progression
  • Discount card for all the shopping centre stores
  • Great seafront location, a short walk from the rail station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops
  • Group Private Medical Insurance provided by BUPA
  • Group Life Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Private Dental Insurance
  • Group Income Protection
  • Company Pension Scheme
  • Cycle To Work Scheme
  • Eye-Care Vouchers

Perks

  • Bring your doggo to work! We're a dog friendly studio, bring your pooch in to meet us.
  • Bean to cup coffee machine in the studio.
  • Fresh fruit and healthy snacks provided daily, breakfast and some not so healthy snacks.
  • In-house clubs and socials. From board games, tennis, football to D&D nights, there are lots of opportunities to socialise.
  • Regular Socials including Project Wrap Parties, team and studio events, Christmas and annual Summer parties and soem great charity fundraising events.

results.title: Backend Software Engineer
results.description:
Anderson Optimization (AO) creates software for the renewable energy industry. AO works with top solar, wind, and battery developers across the US and abroad to efficiently bring more renewable energy onto the power grid.

What you'll do...

This role will primarily be focused on managing and improving a distributed system to detect and classify objects from satellite imagery. The current system uses Node.js for most transactional work with databases and apis and python based services for machine learning and GIS work. The system is built on an event based architecture, utilizing messages and queues for various parts of the system. Your duties will include developing, maintaining, and performing an active contributor role over our software. You will be expected to take requirements and deliver production level code effectively and in a timely manner. In addition, you will voice your opinions on software architecture, perform code reviews, and start to take ownership over the future direction of the architecture of this system. Our team uses an agile kanban development approach and is a fully remote team.

Requirements

Software Developer Responsibilities:

  • Develop high-quality software design and architecture
  • Taking ownership of new feature development and bug fixes
  • Develop tools and applications by producing clean, efficient code
  • Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting
  • Review and debug code
  • Perform validation and verification testing
  • Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to fix and improve products

Software Engineer Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3-5 years experience as a Backend Software Developer
  • Minimum 1-3 years experience working on a distributed system (Nats.io/RabbitMQ)
  • Familiarity with agile kanban development process
  • Experience with common frameworks (express/fastify)
  • Experience with GIS frameworks a plus (GDAL/OGR, PostGIS, Geoserver)
  • Experience with Machine learning (object detection/classification) frameworks a plus (tensorflow/pytorch)
  • Experience with a remote development team
  • Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude
  • Ability to work independently

Benefits

Benefits

  • $115K - $145K
    • Salary range is based on years of experience, experience in industry, and relevant skill set.
  • 401(K) + 4% Match
  • Health insurance reimbursement
  • No vacation limit, minimum 3 weeks
  • Half day summer Fridays
  • Work from anywhere / 100% remote (office available in Boulder, CO if you prefer working onsite).

results.title: Commercial EV Surveyor
results.description:
Company Description

bp pulse has established itself as the market leader in electric vehicle charging, providing solutions for EV drivers to charge at home, at work and on the road. On our mission to make charging fast and hassle-free, our charging points have been used over 30 million times to enable around 200 million miles of zero tailpipe emission driving.



Job Description

AREAS WE REQUIRE SURVEYORS:

NORTH LONDON AND SOUTH EAST OF ENGLAND

We're looking for Commercial EV Surveyors to join the team here at bp pulse as we continue to grow the business. This role is key to our network team and will focus on carrying out desktop and site surveys to scope, design and price EV charging installations. You will be working with and building key relationships with internal and external stakeholders and customers, developing proposed solutions to satisfy their needs.

Key Responsibilities & Tasks 

  • Develop desktop proposals and review of costs

results.title: Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
results.description:
At Bluesight, our mission is to create groundbreaking medication intelligence solutions that increase efficiency, safety and visibility for health systems and pharmaceutical manufacturers.  We empower our customers to deliver the right medicine to the right patient at the right time, every time.  We are a high growth healthcare software technology company with a start-up 'vibe' but over 1000 customers tracking medications using our proven and established solutions.

Kit Check is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to help us redefine what healthcare software can do. Our hundreds of customers rely on us to keep their patients safe and their pharmacies running smoothly while delighting them with every release.

As an SDET you won’t just be clicking on buttons, but diving into the application from the frontend to the backend to the database. We automate most of our end-to-end test cases with Cypress in a continuous integration environment. Not only that, but we have an internet of things where you will be diving into scanning stations, RFID tags, databases, and raw data analysis. Here at Kit Check, we work with a small, tightly-knit team where you have the opportunity to wear many hats and grow in a myriad of directions. This is a collaborative job where we work across the board with dev, product, and customer success to better the product as a whole.


What you will do:
  • Define and drive automation, performance (load, stress, capacity), exploratory, API, and regression testing strategies with innovative tooling for our overall development processes that support and enhance quality assurance within the organization.
  • Establish performance quality goals/metrics from scratch to drive continuous improvement and provide guidance for automation framework enhancement to support continuous testing and delivery.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to help define current and future system performance testing requirements to achieve the highest testing standard.
  • Professional attitude, leading by example, driven and passionate about software quality, agile methodologies, and a strong advocate for improving SDLC / STLC processes.
  • Create SQL queries for database validation and write REST API automation scripts.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and engineers to perform root-cause analysis and preliminary problem diagnosis, identify and track defects in JIRA with detailed steps to reproduce.
  • Build tools to assist with test automation, functional, load / performance testing efforts and assist with innovating existing automation processes.
  • Design and build end-to-end automation tests, and maintain regression testing suite by updating test cases in TestRail to include newly added functionality. 
  • Participate in backlog refinement/sprint planning and work with stakeholders to identify risks and impacts to the application. 
  • Independently own a workstream, develop scripts, utilities, simulators, data sets, and other programmatic test tools as required for test automation and manual testing as needed.


Qualifications:
  • Minimum six (6) years of QA automation and Performance (Load, Scalability, and Stress) testing experience in an Agile engineering environment
  • Experience with JMeter is highly preferred
  • Experience defining, building, and maintaining automated test frameworks for unit/integration / end-to-end testing
  • Experience with automated build and source/version control tools such as Bamboo, Jenkins, Github, or equivalent
  • Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and Agile based testing, including peer review, test automation, and continuous integration
  • Experience working with languages/frameworks including Java, Python, SQL, Postman, Cypress, Karate, Angular, and React
  • Experience with troubleshooting performance-related technical issues and strategizing performance tests for large or distributed product ecosystems
  • Strong experience with CI/CD, test-driven, and BDD methodologies
  • Solid written and verbal communication skills
The standard base pay range for this role is $105,000 - $125,000. In addition to a base salary, this position is also eligible for an amazing benefits package. The actual amount of salary varies depending on experience, performance, and location.

This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States.

Why Bluesight?
Bluesight’s culture is built on innovation and teamwork. There’s room to grow and opportunities to take initiative. You will partner with sharp, motivated teammates looking to disrupt a massive industry—and have fun doing it.  We truly believe that where you work and what you do matters.  Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape!
-Competitive salary
-Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days!
-Generous insurance coverage
-401k program with a company match
-Employee stock options
-Fun, collaborative culture!

EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.
